remarks: Image of a limit under a continuous map, two-arg version.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Sep-2014.)
statement:
rlimcn2.1a $e |- ( ( ph /\ z e. A ) -> B e. X ) $.
rlimcn2.1b $e |- ( ( ph /\ z e. A ) -> C e. Y ) $.
rlimcn2.2a $e |- ( ph -> R e. X ) $.
rlimcn2.2b $e |- ( ph -> S e. Y ) $.
rlimcn2.3a $e |- ( ph -> ( z e. A |-> B ) ~~>r R ) $.
rlimcn2.3b $e |- ( ph -> ( z e. A |-> C ) ~~>r S ) $.
rlimcn2.4 $e |- ( ph -> F : ( X X. Y ) --> CC ) $.
rlimcn2.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. RR+ ) -> E. r e. RR+ E. s e. RR+ A. u e. X A. v e. Y ( ( ( abs ` ( u - R ) ) < r /\ ( abs ` ( v - S ) ) < s ) -> ( abs ` ( ( u F v ) - ( R F S ) ) ) < x ) ) $.
rlimcn2 $p |- ( ph -> ( z e. A |-> ( B F C ) ) ~~>r ( R F S ) ) $.
$d A r s x z $.
$d B r s u v x $.
$d C r s v x $.
$d F r s u v x z $.
$d R r s u v x z $.
$d S r s u v x z $.
$d X u z $.
$d Y u v z $.
$d ph r s x z $.
